newsitem.title: INDIA: India IPCL falls 2.0 pct on net profit.
newsitem.headline: India IPCL falls 2.0 pct on net profit.

text.p: Shares of state-run Indian Petrochemicals Corporation (IPCL) lost 2.50 rupees or 2.05 percent to 119.50 rupees at the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) on Thursday after poor net profit forecast, dealers said.
On Wednesday, IPCL said it expected a net profit of 2.2 billion rupees for the first half of 1996/97 (April-March).
Dealers said the market was disappointed with the below- expected net profit forecast for the six months of 1996/97.
A Reuters poll of 14 leading securities firms earlier this week forecast IPCL to show a 0.6 percent drop in its net profit to 3.03 billion rupees in the same period.

IPCL chairman K.G. Ramanathan at the firm's annual general meeting on Wednesday said depressed international polymer prices and reduction in custom duties in the government's July budget had not helped Indian producers.
